me.taylorkelly.mywarp.platform

Interface PlayerNameResolver


  • public interface PlayerNameResolver
    Resolve player names form unique identifiers and vice-versa.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap<java.lang.String,java.util.UUID> getByName(java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> names)
      Gets the unique identifiers for all players of the given names, if such a player exists.
      com.google.common.base.Optional<java.util.UUID> getByName(java.lang.String name)
      Gets an Optional containing the unique identifier of a player of the given name, if such a player exists.
      com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap<java.util.UUID,java.lang.String> getByUniqueId(java.lang.Iterable<java.util.UUID> uniqueIds)
      Gets all names of players with the given unique identifiers, if available in this cache.
      com.google.common.base.Optional<java.lang.String> getByUniqueId(java.util.UUID uniqueId)
      Gets an Optional with the name of the player with the given unique identifier, if available in this cache.

    • Method Detail

      • getByUniqueId

        com.google.common.base.Optional<java.lang.String> getByUniqueId(java.util.UUID uniqueId)
        Gets an Optional with the name of the player with the given unique identifier, if available in this cache.
        Parameters:
        uniqueId - the unique identifier
        Returns:
        an Optional with the corresponding name

      • getByUniqueId

        com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap<java.util.UUID,java.lang.String> getByUniqueId(java.lang.Iterable<java.util.UUID> uniqueIds)
        Gets all names of players with the given unique identifiers, if available in this cache. If none of the given unique identifiers has a cached name, an empty Map will be returned.
        Parameters:
        uniqueIds - an Iterable of unique identifiers
        Returns:
        a Map with the unique identifier and the corresponding name

      • getByName

        com.google.common.base.Optional<java.util.UUID> getByName(java.lang.String name)
        Gets an Optional containing the unique identifier of a player of the given name, if such a player exists.

        Since Minecraft usernames are case-insensitive, calling getByUniqueId(UUID) with the value returned by this method may return a String with a different case than the String given to this method.

        Calling this method might result in a blocking call to a remote server to get the Profiles.

        Parameters:
        name - the name
        Returns:
        an Optional containing the unique identifier

      • getByName

        com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap<java.lang.String,java.util.UUID> getByName(java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> names)
        Gets the unique identifiers for all players of the given names, if such a player exists. If none of the given names has a unique identifier, an empty Map will be returned.

        Minecraft usernames are case-insensitive; the map returned by this method must make sure that each player's identifier is returned regardless of the case of the requested String. However the Map returned by this method contains the name with the case that was originally given to this method.

        Calling this method might result in a blocking call to a remote server to get the Profiles.

        Parameters:
        names - an Iterable of names
        Returns:
        a Map with the name originally given and the corresponding unique identifier
